Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit - Decrypt
summary:
Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Decrypt

The Gemini Trust Company has agreed to a $5 million settlement with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to resolve allegations of misleading regulators regarding its Bitcoin futures product.

  • The settlement avoids a trial that was set for January 21, 2025.
  • Gemini did not admit to or deny any wrongdoing.
  • The CFTC filed the lawsuit accusing Gemini of making material false statements to obtain approval for its Bitcoin futures.
  • The lawsuit claimed Gemini should have known its statements were misleading.
  • Winklevoss twins have been influential in the crypto space and made donations to political campaigns.
“Gemini knew or reasonably should have known that the statements and information by the company were false or misleading.”

This settlement showcases the ongoing regulatory scrutiny in the cryptocurrency sector and the efforts by firms to comply with regulations.
newTitle: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini to Settle CFTC Case with $5 Million Payment

title: 2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know - News18
summary:
2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 16:35 IST | Source: Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series has been launched with significant upgrades to enhance performance and safety features.

  • The Ather 450X and 450 Apex now have Multi-Mode Traction Control and MagicTwistTM for improved riding experience in city traffic.
  • Pricing starts at Rs 1,29,999 for the 450S, and goes up to Rs 1,99,999 for the 450 Apex model.
  • The scooters are powered by AtherStackTM 6, integrating advanced connectivity features including Google Maps and Live Location Sharing.
  • The range for the 450X with a 3.7 kWh battery is up to 130 km, and the 450 Apex offers 157 km range.
  • An extended warranty of up to 8 years or 80,000 km is offered, ensuring 70% battery health assurance.
“Now, with the 2025 Ather 450, we are improving the safety of the scooters with features like multi-mode traction control which is typically found in high end motorcycles.” - Ravneet S. Phokela, Chief Business Officer of Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series combines modern technology with safety enhancements, making it an appealing choice for urban commuters.
newTitle: 2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know

title: MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million - Decrypt
summary:
MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: Decrypt

Software company MicroStrategy is pushing forward with its Bitcoin buying spree in 2025, today snapping up more than $100 million worth of the orange coin.

MicroStrategy spent $101 million buying 1,070 BTC at an average price of $94,004, maintaining a weekly buying trend that started in November. The total Bitcoin holdings now stand at 447,470, valued at over $45.5 billion.

  • MicroStrategy has made nine consecutive weekly Bitcoin purchases.
  • Today's purchase is significantly lower than previous weeks.
  • There are predictions that the company will hold at least 450,000 BTC by the end of the week.
  • Concerns raised about the company’s high leverage and stock valuation amidst Bitcoin's fluctuating price.
MicroStrategy has acquired 1,070 BTC for ~$101 million at ~$94,004 per bitcoin and has achieved BTC Yield of 48.0% in Q4 2024 and 74.3% in FY 2024.

In conclusion, MicroStrategy's aggressive Bitcoin purchasing strategy demonstrates its commitment to accumulating the cryptocurrency, even as concerns about market stability rise.
newTitle: MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million

  • Vodafone Idea: Sold 50% stake in Firefly Networks for ₹4.5 crore.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Up Amid Trump Tariff Hopes; Nvidia, Chip Stocks Gain On This (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
summary:

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Investors.com

The stock market saw positive momentum with the Dow Jones Industrial Average gaining nearly 400 points influenced by President Trump's remarks on tariffs and strong performance from tech stocks, particularly Nvidia.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose nearly 400 points, or 0.9%.
  • Nvidia surged by nearly 5%, clearing the 146.54 buy point of a double-bottom base.

title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm - DNA India
summary:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm

Publication Date: January 6, 2025

Source: DNA India

Mukesh Ambani continues to expand his business empire with the introduction of a new rehydrating beverage, RasKik Gluco Energy, priced at just Rs 10 per single-serve drink. This move follows Reliance's recent acquisition of Campa Cola and positions the company to compete directly with Tata Consumer Products in the beverage market.

  • Reliance's market cap stands at Rs 16.48 lakh crore.
  • The RasKik Gluco Energy beverage aims to redefine rehydration in India.
  • Products currently offered include mango, apple, mixed fruit, coconut water, and nimbu pani.
  • Reliance aims to expand its portfolio inspired by regional fruit varieties.
"RasKik is now uniquely positioned to provide a variety of accessible and great quality fruit-based drinks." - Reliance Consumer Products Ltd

This product launch exemplifies Reliance's commitment to merging traditional Indian consumer heritage with modern product offerings, highlighting the company's ambition to become a leader in the beverage sector.
newTitle: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Launches Rs 10 Beverage, Challenging Tata

summary:

Publication Date: January 6, 2023 | Source: FXStreet

The Euro is experiencing a strong recovery against the US Dollar, bolstered by political developments and positive economic data from Europe.

  • The Euro climbed over 1% to above 1.0400 after hitting a low of 1.0224 last week.
  • President-elect Trump is considering universal tariffs for critical imports amidst political instability in Italy and Canada.
  • Strong European PMI data and Germany's inflation metrics are contributing to the Euro's rise.
“Traders in the US session will either add further short EUR/USD positions or push the Euro towards 1.0500.”

title: FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions - FDA.gov
summary:
FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: U.S. Food and Drug Administration

The U.S. FDA has released draft guidance aimed at using artificial intelligence (AI) for supporting regulatory decisions related to drug and biological product safety, effectiveness, and quality, marking a first in the agency's efforts.

  • The guidance promotes a risk-based framework for assessing AI model credibility.
  • FDA Commissioner Robert M. Califf emphasizes AI's potential to transform clinical research and product development.
  • The FDA has substantial experience with AI in regulatory submissions since 2016.
  • Stakeholder feedback was integral in framing these guidelines.
“With the appropriate safeguards in place, artificial intelligence has transformative potential to advance clinical research and accelerate medical product development to improve patient care.” - FDA Commissioner Robert M. Califf, M.D.

This draft guidance is open for public comment within 90 days, aiming for alignment with industry experiences and sponsor engagement effectiveness.
newTitle: FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions

Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment - Decrypt
summary:
Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Decrypt

Bitcoin has surpassed the $100,000 mark for the first time this year, buoyed by positive trader sentiment and developments in the market.

  • Bitcoin reached a price of $101,192, though it has not yet returned to its all-time high of $108,135.
  • The cryptocurrency traded below $100,000 for a nearly three-week period before this increase.
  • Factors such as the Federal Reserve's interest rate projections affected market sentiment, but optimism remains high.
  • President-elect Trump's intention to establish a U.S. strategic Bitcoin reserve is influencing investor behavior.
  • Bitcoin is seen as navigating a tactical trading range, presenting unique strategic opportunities.
“Rather than a continuous rally, Bitcoin appears to be navigating a tactical trading range...” - 10x Research

The recent surge in Bitcoin's price reflects both market resilience and strategic positioning as investors adapt to changing economic conditions.
newTitle: Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment

title: Sensex to cross 1 lakh soon? Target 2025: 'Expect India to be...' - Morgan Stanley's BULL vs BEAR stock market case - ET Now
summary:

The year 2025 may bring significant gains for stock market investors, according to Morgan Stanley, which outlines a bullish and bearish position for the BSE Sensex's future performance.

  • Morgan Stanley projects a 14% rise in Sensex by December 2025, potentially reaching 93,000.
  • The brokerage favors cyclicals over defensives and small/mid-caps over large-caps.
  • Bull case target for Sensex is set at 105,000, while the bear case target is 70,000.

title: Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens, Know Details - News18
summary:
SBI Launches Special FD Scheme for Super Senior Citizens Aged 80+

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: News18

The State Bank of India has introduced the 'SBI Patrons' scheme catering specifically to Super Senior Citizens aged 80 and above, offering higher interest rates on term deposits.

  • The new scheme, 'SBI Patrons', is geared toward both new and existing customers.
  • Super Senior Citizens are defined as individuals aged 80 years or older.
  • Interest rates for this scheme are set at 10 basis points higher than standard senior citizen rates.
  • The scheme is aimed at recognizing the patronage of Super Senior Citizens with added financial benefits.
  • Minimum deposit starts at Rs 1,000, with an upper limit less than Rs 3 crores.
  • Deposits can be made for a period ranging from 7 days up to 10 years.
  • The scheme includes options for premature withdrawal with applicable penalties.
“SBI has a market share of about 23% in deposits.”

This initiative is part of SBI’s commitment to support senior citizens, enabling them to achieve better returns on their savings.
newTitle: SBI Launches Special FD Scheme for Super Senior Citizens Aged 80+

title: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment - News18
summary:
Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: Moneycontrol

India’s second-largest IT services company, Infosys, has decided to postpone its annual salary hikes until the fourth quarter of FY25 due to ongoing global market challenges.

  • Salary increments, typically implemented earlier in the year, will now be staggered; some will take effect in January 2025, with others in April 2025.
  • Other major IT firms have also deferred pay raises as a response to weakened client budgets and macroeconomic pressures.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential net profit increase, reaching Rs 6,506 crore, despite missing market expectations.
  • The company's margins improved slightly, supported by better operational efficiencies and lower onsite costs.
  • Selective increments are still being offered to high-performing employees in specialized fields like AI.
“In today’s uncertain economic environment, holding on to a job itself is being viewed by many as a significant advantage.”

Despite the delay in pay hikes, some analysts believe that Infosys' margin pressures may ease thanks to strategic cost-management initiatives.
newTitle: Infosys Delays Salary Increases: Key Details on Pay Increment Plans

title: Titagarh Rail delivers India's first driverless 'Make-in-India' trainset to Bengaluru Metro - Deccan Herald
summary:
Titagarh Rail delivers India's first driverless 'Make-in-India' trainset to Bengaluru Metro

Published: 06 January 2025, 14:11 IST

Kolkata: Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd has achieved a significant milestone by handing over its first driverless, Made-in-India trainset to Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation's Yellow Line, marking a critical advancement in India's urban mobility journey.

  • The trainset was produced at Titagarh Rail's metro manufacturing facility in Uttarpara, West Bengal.
  • It features a stainless steel body and is designed for high performance on the 18-km stretch from Electronics City.
  • Union Minister Manohar Lal commended the achievement, stating that India aims to surpass the U.S. in metro rail operations in the next five years.
  • The Automated train includes advanced automation allowing it to operate in driverless mode.
  • Titagarh will additionally supply two more trainsets for the Yellow Line by April and plans to ramp up production.
"As we inaugurate Bengaluru Metro’s new trainset and surpass 1,000 kilometres of operational metro rail, we celebrate a significant milestone in India’s urban mobility journey..." - Manohar Lal

This delivery highlights India's progress in rail manufacturing and aligns with the Prime Minister’s vision of a developed India.
newTitle: Titagarh Rail Delivers India's First Driverless Trainset to Bengaluru Metro

title: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said - ET Now
summary:
Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said

Updated: January 5, 2025 09:20 IST

Bengaluru's Yellow Line, connecting RV Road to Bommasandra, has generated excitement but the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has denied January 6, 2025, launch rumors. The first train will be unveiled on that date, with subsequent deliveries scheduled.

  • The Yellow Line will span 18.82 kilometers with 18 stations.
  • MP Tejasvi Surya confirmed the delivery schedule of trains.
  • The initial operations will feature three trains, expanding by August 2025.
“I am equally frustrated with the repeated delays in the start of the Yellow Line.” – Tejasvi Surya

The Yellow Line is anticipated to enhance connectivity in Bengaluru, especially aiding commuters to the Electronics City tech hub.
newTitle: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra Section Update

FinMin wants banks, NBFCs to join hands to fund large infra projects - Business Standard
summary:
FinMin wants banks, NBFCs to join hands to fund large infra projects

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Not specified

The finance ministry has urged banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to enhance their involvement in financing significant infrastructure projects essential for India’s vision of becoming a developed nation by 2047.

Nagaraju highlighted the importance of pooling resources and shifting towards innovative financing solutions while managing risks effectively.

  • The finance ministry advocates for increased funding from banks and NBFCs for infrastructure.
  • Emphasis on innovation and risk management in financing.
  • IIFCL has sanctioned loans of Rs 2.8 trillion, aiming for Rs 1 trillion in the next three years.
  • Private investments in sectors like Indian Railways are encouraged for better infrastructure development.
“Infrastructure projects are typically viable if there is no fraud, funds are not diverted, and timelines are adhered to.” - M Nagaraju

In conclusion, this collaboration between banks and NBFCs is pivotal to achieving substantial infrastructure advancements necessary for India's economic growth.
newTitle: FinMin Encourages Banks and NBFCs to Fund Large Infrastructure Projects

title: Tata Punch tops 2024 sales charts; ends Maruti Suzuki's 40-year reign - Business Standard
summary:
Tata Punch Tops 2024 Sales Charts, Ending Maruti Suzuki's 40-Year Reign

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

For the first time in four decades, a non-Maruti Suzuki India car has topped the list of India’s best-selling cars. In 2024, the Tata Punch, a sub-compact sport utility vehicle (SUV), became the highest-selling vehicle by delivering 202,030 units.

  • The SUV market share increased from 32% in 2021 to over 50% in 2024.
  • The top five best-selling cars included three SUVs: Tata Punch, Maruti Brezza, and Hyundai Creta.
  • Maruti’s market share dropped from 52% in 2018 to 41% in 2024.
  • Consumers are increasingly favoring premium feature cars.

2024 highest selling cars

> Tata Punch – 202,030 units

> Maruti Wagon R – 190,855 units

> Maruti Ertiga – 190,091 units

> Maruti Brezza – 188,160 units

> Hyundai Creta – 186,919 units

Source: DRChoksey FinServ

Conclusion: The Tata Punch's record sales signify a major shift in consumer preferences towards SUVs and premium features, marking a pivotal change in the Indian automotive market.
newTitle: Tata Punch Tops 2024 Sales Charts, Ending Maruti Suzuki's 40-Year Reign

title: SEBI relaxes norms for settling client accounts inactive for 30 days - The Economic Times
summary:
SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

Publication Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has relaxed norms regarding the settlement of accounts by brokerages for clients who have not traded in over 30 days. This aims to improve efficiency and facilitate business.

  • The revised rules allow settlements for clients who trade again after 30 days and before the next monthly settlement cycle.
  • This change comes following concerns raised by the Brokers’ Industry Standards Forum regarding procedural inefficiencies.
  • Settlements are now to be aligned with the annual calendar of settlements notified by exchanges.
  • The new provisions take effect immediately.
"It has been decided to revise the requirement of mandatory settlement of such clients’ funds." - SEBI circular

This regulatory change is expected to streamline processes and enhance the ease of doing business for brokerages while safeguarding investor interests.
newTitle: SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

title: Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT route - Business Standard
summary:
Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to Acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT Route

Publication Date: Monday

Source: Nirma Group Announcement

Nuvoco Vistas Corp, a company promoted by the Nirma Group, has emerged as the successful applicant for Vadraj Cement in a corporate insolvency resolution process (CIRP).

  • The transaction will increase Nuvoco's cement capacity from 25 MTPA to approximately 31 MTPA, a 20% increase.
  • The resolution plan submitted by Nuvoco has been approved by the committee of creditors.
  • Nuvoco plans a phased investment over 15 months for refurbishment of assets and operational improvements.
  • Production is expected to commence around Q3 of FY27, pending approvals.
  • Vadraj Cement is currently undergoing insolvency with admitted claims of Rs 8,180.61 crore.
“Overall investment, including refurbishment of assets, will be more cost-effective than greenfield or brownfield expansions.”

This acquisition reinforces Nuvoco's position as the fifth largest cement manufacturer in India.
newTitle: Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to Acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT Route

title: European shares, euro surge after report of more targeted US tariffs - Reuters
